channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10675] IntegrationTestIngestWithACL should allow User to be passed as Parameter
item.description:
The IntegrationTestIngestWithACL needs to be modified to allow the user to be passed in as an argument at run time. Currently, the test is using a fixed set of user names which cannot be authenticated via Kerberos, causing the test to fail. Allowing the username to be passed at run time will allow a user that is already authenticated by Kerberos to be used, and resolve the failure.


2014-02-06 02:58:25,315|beaver.machine|INFO|RUNNING: /usr/bin/kinit -c /hbase.kerberos.ticket -k -t /home/hadoopqa/keytabs/hbase.headless.keytab hbase

item.summary: IntegrationTestIngestWithACL should allow User to be passed as Parameter

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12633140/HBASE-10675_1.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12633140

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 15 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop2-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-thrift.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8912//console

This message is automatically generated.

IntegrationTestIngest


+  protected String userNames;

+  protected String superUser;

Both these states are used only in class IntegrationTestIngestWithACL. Can we move these to here?

LoadTestTool


+        // Create an args with 2 elements

+        args = new String[2];

+        args[0] = userNames;

+        args[1] = clazzAndArgs[1];

What abt the other args if any passed with data gen class name?


+  public static final String OPT_SUPERUSER = "superuser";

+  public static final String OPT_USERS = "userlist";

+

These opts makes sense only when LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL is been used. Can we pass these 2 opts (owner and other users) as args after the gen class name? ( OPT_GENERATOR = "generator"; ) We can pass the args as : seperated in a pre defined order.
String[] clazzAndArgs = cmd.getOptionValue(OPT_GENERATOR).split(COLON);

Can we pass these 2 opts (owner and other users) as args after the gen class name? ( OPT_GENERATOR = "generator"; )

This is how it was previously. But the users and list was hardcoded. Now I thought of changing it because instead of passing it with the generator we need to pass it to the IntegraitonWith ACL tool. We have to use the LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL only to make this work. So it is ok to pass it to the IntegrationTool only as arguments. Even if you don't pass the system will go with default users.

Both these states are used only in class IntegrationTestIngestWithACL

Okie. May be i forgot to change them. I can do it.

And also LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL does not do anything with the user name and list except that it uses the factor to determine what type of ACLS to add.


./hbase --config /usr/lib/hbase/conf/ org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestIngestWithACL -superuser <user> -userlist <user1>,<user2>,<user3>

We can avoid the hard coded names in IntegrationTestIngestWithACL. That one can take the names as arg. When these args are passed to LTT, now in the patch, it passed as top level args. What I say is make them pass as sub args for the generator. We pass generator arg to LTT from IntegrationTestIngestWithACL. Along with this class name we can pass some more args also as colon seperated. So pass it as
LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL:<super user>:<comma seperated users>:<other args if any>
We have instance of check for the generator in LTT. There we make it is necessary that if LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL is the generator then class name should be followed with at least 2 args super user and other users.. If still some more remaining, pass them as args to the generator class. (Well this is also missing in the patch) Def names assumed in the LTT also can be removed I would say. U can go with def values for the 2 args in IntegrationTestIngestWithACL.

Okie I don't have any strong opinion on changing this. anyway will go back to the old code itself in passing the args to the LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL.
Currently not missing any arguments from the LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL. Because I only pass one arg in the LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL. Okie will change it and upload a patch.

Currently not missing any arguments from the LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL

Ok I will make the args to be passed as COLON seperated.

LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL:<super user>:<comma seperated users>:<other args if any>

+1 for this here too

Updated patch. the args are passed the same way. But applies to the LoadTestGeneratorWithACL.
Previously LoadTesttool itself was using the superuser and userlist configuration.

args = clazzAndArgs.length == 1 ? new String[0] : Arrays.copyOfRange(clazzAndArgs, 1,

+          clazzAndArgs.length);

This is wrong for case of dataGen instanceof LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL
There it should be like


args = clazzAndArgs.length == 3 ? new String[0] : Arrays.copyOfRange(clazzAndArgs, 3,

+          clazzAndArgs.length);

Also u can check for min length of 3. Making superUser and users arg optional here wont work out as we rely on the order of args coming in.

Default values for superUser and users can be added in IntegrationTestIngestWithACL. If arg is not passed, sb.append(superUser); will add a String null
So the below null checks wont make effect


+        if (clazzAndArgs[1] != null) {

+          superUser = clazzAndArgs[1];

+        }

+        if (clazzAndArgs[2] != null) {

+          userNames = clazzAndArgs[2];

+        }

The null related issue is valid. I was checking for null thinking it as string. But there is a string builder. Thanks for pointing it out.


args = clazzAndArgs.length == 3 ? new String[0] : Arrays.copyOfRange(clazzAndArgs, 3,

+          clazzAndArgs.length);

This start index should be 1 only here because we need the usernames for the beforeMutate inside the generator.
Latest patch updated. Addressed the other comments.

+        args = Arrays.copyOfRange(clazzAndArgs, 1,

+            clazzAndArgs.length);

LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL#initialize(String[] args) expects the 1st arg to be the omma separated users. It don’t need the super user name
So We have to take like
args = Arrays.copyOfRange(clazzAndArgs, 2, clazzAndArgs.length);
clazzAndArgs array's 1st element clazzAndArgs[0] is the class name.

First thing is we are now making the user to pass the superuser and userlist along with the Generator class so it needs the superuser (1st arg) and userlist(2nd arg) when you run LoadTestTool alone.
In my previous patch I was trying to avoid this by passing the superuser and userlist to the LoadTestTool itself. Now one has to pass using the Generator only.
Now to the initialize() though am passing the userlist the beforeMutate does not need the super user. Hence though we are passing 3 elements, we reading only the last two to be used.
So passing one more arg atleast would help in the validation if LoadTestGeneratorWithACL is used with LoadTestTool.
Also Arrays.copyOfRange is index inclusive. So passing 1 would mean the second element like saying arr[1].

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12633363/HBASE-10675_3.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12633363

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 21 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.TestPerTableCFReplication

This message is automatically generated.

LoadTestDataGeneratorWithACL#initialize(String[] args) expects the 1st arg to be the omma separated users.

Oh sorry Ram. I some how missed this class changes in the patch. Fine no probs at all then. +1
Committed to trunk and 0.98. Thanks for the reviews everyone.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
To use this feature of passing superuser and userlist we need to give the following command
{code}
./hbase --config /usr/lib/hbase/conf/ org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestIngestWithACL -superuser <user> -userlist <user1>,<user2>,<user3>
{code}
Ensure that the userlist is comma seperated.
